column1: 1. Rest: While brief periods of inactivity can help with acute back pain
2. Painkillers: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDs) or acetaminophen
column2: both of which are available over-the-counter

column1: 3. Applying heat or cold therapy to the affected area can assist to lessen discomfort and swelling.
4. Physical therapy: Particular stretches and exercises can increase flexibility
5. Chiropractic or massage therapy can assist to relax muscles
6. Corticosteroid injections may be used in some circumstances to reduce inflammation and relieve pain.
7. Surgery is often a last resort and is only suggested in the most severe situations or after other therapies have failed.
